posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
An attempt to have a multi-purpose Druid build, this character is proficient in long range combat via Zen Archery, can fight in melee via elemental shape (infinite uses a day eventually and easier to move around than dragon, not to mention crit immunity) and the mighty dragon shape. Animal companion, summons and animal empathy together with FTR combat prowess and Monk special features help the preepic levels, with the possibility to use wild shape when needed. Elemental and dragon shape are gonna be the epic melee choice, while longbow remains the ranged one. Buffs will enhance both the human and shifted shapes and the former has an arsenal of offense spells to use too. Scribe scroll for a personal reserve of key spells.

There's the possibility to drop EWS, go Druid 29/FTR 4/Monk 7 (Druid 12/FTR 4/Monk 4 preepic) or keep EWS going Druid 28/FTR 5/Monk 7 (same preepic split) but give up one of EP and AS to be able to get an earlier Monk 6 (KD/IKD and +10% speed). In the case EWS is dropped, one might want to consider dropping WS too for IC: unarmed/longbow.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey Kail, nice strong Druid build with all the elements to be very playable and powerful. As usual I don't have much to say on a well thought out build, but one thing caught my attention. If you do make an effort to become proficient in ranged attacks and spells, then you can let go of Blind Fight to get Improved Critical either unarmed or long bows and snipe them before they can cast Improved Invisibility, and if they do it through a scroll, then you can dispel them. I would also drop Scribe Scroll for the other Improved Critical feat to increase your combat capabilities at the cost of, well, consumables. Other than that it's an excellent build, IMO with the best possible spread for this class combo and cleverly avoiding XP penalty.

One more thing, you can consider changing Monk 6 to 37 inbetween the Fighter levels, which won't cause XP penalty but will allow for an earlier Tumble dump.

Well done!
